item.title: Tara add a quote by Donna Tartt
item.description: "Does such a thing as 'the fatal flaw,' that showy dark crack running down the middle of a life, exist outside literature? I used to think it didn't. Now I think it does. And I think that mine is this: a morbid longing for the picturesque at all costs." -- Donna Tartt

item.title: Tara add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "Little notes, scrawled on half-sheets of paper, and letters, when he was away, page after page, intimate, <i>their</i> news. Her voice, echoing through the house, and down the garden, careless and familiar like the writing in the book. And I had to call him Maxim." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: Tara add a quote by Vikki Wakefield
item.description: "I know that this is as close as I'll ever get. He's broken in ways I'm not." -- Vikki Wakefield
